intro: Mimulus modestus, commonly known as the humble monkeyflower, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the western United States. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features bright yellow, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in streambanks and woodland edges. Mimulus modestus plays an important role in supporting local ecosystems by providing nectar and habitat for various insects.
